The set of plots with the running mean plotted in seagreen3 are plots based on data from only _tep-1_ SNPs from `tep_M82_heinz_2.vcf`. The mapping parameters are highlighted in Leslie Herrera's md file called `tep_project` with further information on heinz mapping, merging and calling in the `tep_heinz-heinz` md file.

This script is based off of Leslie's des9_tep_2_snp.rmd with edits for including Heinz calls and filtering M82 reads. 

**Note** This vcf _does_ have the M82 and Heinz calls merged with it and the M82 and Heinz SNPs are **not** used in analysis. (deletions and SNPs were anaylzed in separate scripts)



The R commands are as follows:

```
#Set up
library(plyr)
library(ggplot2)
library(caTools)

setwd("~/Desktop/Honors Thesis Important Stuff/vcf and BSA plots/")

tep_data<-read.table("tep_M82_2.vcf", header = FALSE, stringsAsFactors=FALSE)
summary(tep_data)
head(tep_data)
colnames(tep_data) <- c("CHROM","POS","ID","REF","ALT","QUAL","FILTER","INFO","FORMAT","tep_calls","M82_calls","Heinz_calls")

#get rid of alleles with more than one alternate allele
tep_data <- tep_data[!grepl(",",tep_data$ALT),]

#fix empty data entry
tep_data$tep_calls[tep_data$tep_calls=="."] <- "NA:NA:NA:NA:NA:NA:NA,NA,NA"
tep_data$M82_calls[tep_data$M82_calls=="."] <- "NA:NA:NA:NA:NA:NA:NA,NA,NA"
tep_data$Heinz_calls[tep_data$Heinz_calls=="."] <- "NA:NA:NA:NA:NA:NA:NA,NA,NA"


tep_tmp <- ldply(strsplit(tep_data$tep_calls, split = ":"))
colnames(tep_tmp) <- c("tep.gt","tep.read.depth","tep.ref.depth","tep.ref.qual","tep.alt.depth","tep.alt.qual","tep.lik")
head(tep_tmp)

M82_tmp <- ldply(strsplit(tep_data$M82_calls, split = ":"))
colnames(M82_tmp) <- c("M82.gt","M82.read.depth","M82.ref.depth","M82.ref.qual","M82.alt.depth","M82.alt.qual","M82.lik")
head(M82_tmp)

Heinz_tmp <- ldply(strsplit(tep_data$M82_calls, split = ":"))
colnames(Heinz_tmp) <- c("Heinz.gt","Heinz.read.depth","Heinz.ref.depth","Heinz.ref.qual","Heinz.alt.depth","Heinz.alt.qual","Heinz.lik")
head(Heinz_tmp)

#convert values to numeric

tep_tmp[,c(-1,-7)] <- apply(tep_tmp[,c(-1,-7)],2,as.numeric)
M82_tmp[,c(-1,-7)] <- apply(M82_tmp[,c(-1,-7)],2,as.numeric)
Heinz_tmp[,c(-1,-7)] <- apply(Heinz_tmp[,c(-1,-7)],2,as.numeric)

summary(tep_tmp)
summary(M82_tmp)
summary(Heinz_tmp)

tep_data<- cbind(tep_data, tep_tmp, M82_tmp, Heinz_tmp)

names(tep_data)

#Next steps
#Filter to keep rows where M82 = "1/1"
#Filter to keep rows where heinz ="0/0"

tep_snp_data <- subset(tep_data, tep.gt != "0/0")
tep_snp_data <- tep_snp_data[grepl("1/1",tep_snp_data$M82.gt),]
tep_snp_data <- tep_snp_data[grepl("0/0",tep_snp_data$Heinz.gt),]

tep_snp_data <- tep_snp_data[grep("TYPE=snp", tep_snp_data$INFO),]
tep_snp_data <- tep_snp_data[!is.na(tep_snp_data$tep.read.depth),]

#Filter for quality and depth

small_data <- tep_snp_data[sample(nrow(tep_snp_data),10000),]
hist(small_data$tep.read.depth[small_data$tep.read.depth < 100],breaks=50)
hist(small_data$tep.alt.qual[small_data$tep.alt.qual < 400],breaks=40)


tep_snp_data <- tep_snp_data[tep_snp_data$tep.read.depth < 60,]
tep_snp_data <- tep_snp_data[tep_snp_data$tep.read.depth > 5,]
tep_snp_data <- tep_snp_data[tep_snp_data$tep.alt.qual > 100 | tep_snp_data$tep.ref.qual > 100,]

#Check to make sure filtering worked:

hist(tep_snp_data$tep.read.depth)
hist(tep_snp_data$tep.alt.qual,breaks=40)

# Calculate for tep %M82

tep_snp_data$tep.percent <- (tep_snp_data$tep.alt.depth / tep_snp_data$tep.read.depth)*100
tep_snp_data$tep.runmean.15 <- unlist(tapply(tep_snp_data$tep_percent,tep_snp_data$CHROM,runmean,k=15,endrule="constant"))
tep_snp_data$tep.runmean.20 <- unlist(tapply(tep_snp_data$tep_percent,tep_snp_data$CHROM,runmean,k=20,endrule="constant"))

#plot each chromosome and save to a pdf

pdf("tep_only_M82_snp_2_rm20.pdf",width=12,height=8)
for(chrom in unique(tep_snp_data$CHROM)) {
  pl <- ggplot(tep_snp_data[tep_snp_data$CHROM==chrom,],aes(x=POS))
  pl <- pl + geom_point(alpha=0.5,aes(y=tep_percent))
  pl <- pl + geom_line(color="seagreen3",lwd=1,aes(y=tep.runmean.20))
  print(pl + ggtitle(chrom))
}
dev.off()
```
